1.verse: The record of the origin of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

2.verse: Abraham was the father of Isaac, Isaac was the father of Jacob, and Jacob was the father of Judah and his brothers,

3.verse: Judah was the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar, Perez was the father of Hezron, and Hezron was the father of Ram,

4.verse: Ram was the father of Amminadab, Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, and Nahshon was the father of Salmon,

5.verse: Salmon was the father of Boaz by Rahab, Boaz was the father of Obed by Ruth, and Obed was the father of Jesse,

6.verse: and Jesse was the father of David the king. David was the father of Solomon by the wife of Uriah.

7.verse: Solomon was the father of Rehoboam, Rehoboam was the father of Abijah, and Abijah was the father of Asaph,

8.verse: Asaph was the father of Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat was the father of Joram, and Joram was the father of Uzziah,

9.verse: Uzziah was the father of Jotham, Jotham was the father of Ahaz, and Ahaz was the father of Hezekiah,

10.verse: Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh, Manasseh was the father of Amos, and Amos was the father of Josiah,

11.verse: Josiah was the father of Jechoniah and his brothers at the time of the deportation to Babylon.

12.verse: After the deportation to Babylon, Jechoniah was the father of Shealtiel, and Shealtiel was the father of Zerubbabel,

13.verse: Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud, Abiud was the father of Eliakim, and Eliakim was the father of Azor,

14.verse: Azor was the father of Zadok, Zadok was the father of Achim, and Achim was the father of Eliud,

15.verse: Eliud was the father of Eleazar, Eleazar was the father of Matthan, and Matthan was the father of Jacob,

16.verse: Jacob was the father of Joseph the husband of Mary, from whom Jesus was born, who is called Christ.

17.verse: So all the generations from Abraham to David were fourteen generations, and from David to the deportation to Babylon fourteen generations, and from the deportation to Babylon to the Christ fourteen generations.

18.verse: Now the birth of Jesus Christ took place in this way: When his mother Mary was pledged in marriage to Joseph, before they had come together, she was found to be with child by the Holy Spirit.

19.verse: Because her husband Joseph was a just man and unwilling to disgrace her in public, he planned to release her quietly.

20.verse: But as he pondered this, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife; for that which has been conceived in her is by the Holy Spirit.

21.verse: And she will bear a son, and you are to call him Jesus, for he will save his people from their sins.”

22.verse: All this took place so that what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet might be fulfilled:

23.verse: “Behold, the virgin shall conceive and give birth to a son, and they shall call him Emmanuel,” which is translated “God is with us.”

24.verse: When Joseph arose from sleep, he did what the angel of the Lord had told him, and he took her as his wife,

25.verse: but he had no marital relations with her until she had given birth to a son; and he called him Jesus.

1.verse: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the East came to Jerusalem,

2.verse: saying, “Where is the one who has been born king of the Jews? For we saw his star at its rising and have come to worship him.”

3.verse: Now when king Herod heard this, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him;

4.verse: and gathering all the ruling priests and scribes of the people, he inquired of them where the Messiah was to be born.

5.verse: They told him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for thus it is written by the prophet:

6.verse: ‘And you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; for from you will come a ruler who will shepherd my people Israel.’”

7.verse: Then Herod secretly called for the magi and found out from them exactly what time the star had appeared.

8.verse: Then he sent them to Bethlehem, saying, “Go and search diligently for the child; and when you have found him, report back to me, so that I also may go and worship him.”

9.verse: And having listened to the king, they continued their journey, and the star that they had seen in its rising went before them until it stopped over the place where the child was.

10.verse: And when they caught sight of the star, they rejoiced exceedingly with great joy.

11.verse: Upon entering the house they saw the child with Mary his mother, and falling to their knees they worshiped him. Then opening their treasure chests, they presented him with gifts, gold and frankincense and myrrh.

12.verse: And being warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they left for their own country by another way.

13.verse: After they had gone, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph, saying, “Rise, take the child and his mother, flee to Egypt, and stay there until I tell you; for Herod is going to search for the child to destroy him.”

14.verse: So he got up, took the child and his mother by night, and left for Egypt,

15.verse: and was there until the death of Herod. This was to fulfill what was spoken by the Lord through the prophet: “Out of Egypt I have called my son.”

16.verse: Then Herod, when he saw that he had been tricked by the wise men, became furious; and he sent and killed all the male children in Bethlehem and in all her regions who were two years old or under, according to the time that he had determined from the wise men.

17.verse: Then was fulfilled what was spoken by the prophet Jeremiah:

18.verse: “A voice was heard in Ramah, weeping and loud lamentation, Rachel weeping for her children; she refused to be comforted, because they were no more.”

19.verse: But when Herod died, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

20.verse: saying, “Rise, take the child and his mother, and go to the land of Israel, for those who were seeking the child’s life are dead.”

21.verse: So Joseph got up, took the child and his mother, and went into the land of Israel.

22.verse: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there, and being warned in a dream he went into the region of Galilee.

23.verse: And he went and settled in a town called Nazareth, that what was spoken by the prophets might be fulfilled: “He will be called a Nazarene.”

1.verse: In those days John the Baptist began his mission in the wilderness of Judea, proclaiming,

2.verse: “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

3.verse: For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet when he said, ‘The voice of one crying out in the wilderness: Prepare the way of the Lord; make his paths straight.’”

4.verse: Now John wore clothing made of camel’s hair, with a leather belt about his waist; and his food was locusts and wild honey.

5.verse: At that time people were going out to him from Jerusalem and all Judea and all the region along the Jordan,

6.verse: and they were being baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.

7.verse: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for baptism, he said to them, “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?

8.verse: Therefore bear fruit worthy of repentance,

9.verse: and do not presume you can say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father’; for I say to you that God is able from these stones to raise up children to Abraham.

10.verse: Even now the axe is lying at the root of the trees; so any tree that does not bear good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.

11.verse: “I baptize you with water for repentance, but the one who comes after me is greater than I—I am not worthy even to remove his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.

12.verse: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will clean out his threshing floor and gather his wheat into the barn; but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.”

13.verse: Then Jesus came from Galilee to John at the Jordan river to be baptized by him.

14.verse: But John tried to prevent him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and yet do you come to me?”

15.verse: But Jesus answered him, “Let it be so now; for in this way it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he allowed him.

16.verse: And when Jesus was baptized, just as he was coming up from the water, the heavens were opened, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and lighting on him.

17.verse: And a voice from heaven said, “This is my Son, the Beloved, in whom I delight.”

1.verse: Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

2.verse: And after fasting forty days and forty nights, he was hungry.

3.verse: And the tempter came to him and said, “If you are the Son of God, command these stones to become bread.”

4.verse: But he replied, “It stands written, “Man does not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God.”

5.verse: Then the devil took him into the holy city, placed him on the pinnacle of the temple,

6.verse: and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it stands written: ‘He will command his angels concerning you,’ and, ‘on their hands they will hold you up, lest you strike your foot against a stone.’”

7.verse: Jesus said to him, “It also stands written: ‘You shall not put the Lord your God to the test.’”

8.verse: Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their splendor;

9.verse: and he said to him, “All these I will give you, if you will fall down and worship me.”

10.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “Away with you, Satan! For it stands written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God and serve him alone.’”

11.verse: Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and began to take care of him.

12.verse: Now when Jesus heard that John had been arrested, he withdrew into Galilee.

13.verse: And leaving Nazareth he went and lived in Capernaum by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali,

14.verse: so that what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled:

15.verse: “Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali, toward the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles—

16.verse: the people living in darkness have seen a great light, and on those living in the region and shadow of death, a light has dawned.”

17.verse: From then on Jesus began to proclaim, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”

18.verse: As he was walking by the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon who was called Peter and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

19.verse: And he said to them, “Come, follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.”

20.verse: Immediately they left their nets and followed him.

21.verse: And going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, in a boat with Zebedee their father, preparing their nets. And he called to them.

22.verse: Immediately they left the boat and their father and followed him.

23.verse: And Jesus went throughout all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.

24.verse: And the report about him spread throughout Syria, and they brought to him all who were suffering with various diseases and pains, demoniacs, epileptics, and paralytics, and he healed them.

25.verse: And great crowds followed him from Galilee and the Decapolis, from Jerusalem and Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.

1.verse: And seeing the crowds, Jesus went up on the mountainside; and when he had sat down, his disciples came to him.

2.verse: And he opened his mouth and began to teach them, saying:

3.verse: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

4.verse: Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.

5.verse: Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.

6.verse: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be fully satisfied.

7.verse: Blessed are the merciful, for they will be shown mercy.

8.verse: Blessed are the pure in heart, for they will see God.

9.verse: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called sons of God.

10.verse: Blessed are those who are persecuted for the sake of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

11.verse: Blessed are you when others revile you and persecute you and say all kinds of evil against you falsely on account of me.

12.verse: Rejoice and be very glad because your reward is great in heaven; for that is how they persecuted the prophets who were before you.

13.verse: “You are the salt of the earth, but if salt has lost its taste, how will it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything but to be thrown out and trampled under foot by people.

14.verse: You are the light of the world. A city built on a hill cannot be hidden.

15.verse: Nor do people light a lamp and put it under the meal-tub, but on a stand, and it gives light to all in the house.

16.verse: Let your light shine like that before others, so that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven.”

17.verse: “Do not think that I came to abolish the law or the prophets. I did not come to abolish, but to fulfill.

18.verse: I tell you the truth, until heaven and earth pass away, not a single iota or one little stroke will pass from the law until everything takes place.

19.verse: Therefore whoever relaxes one of the least of these commandments and teaches others to do the same will be called least in the kingdom of heaven; but whoever does them and teaches others, this person will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

20.verse: For I tell you that unless your righteousness exceeds beyond that of the scribes and Pharisees, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.

21.verse: “You have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not murder,’ and, ‘whoever murders will be liable to judgment.’

22.verse: But I say to you that anyone who is angry with his brother will be liable to judgment; and whoever says to his brother, ‘Raka,’ will be liable to the council; and whoever says, ‘You fool!’ will be liable to the hell of fire.

23.verse: Therefore if you are bringing your gift to the altar and there remember that your brother has something against you,

24.verse: leave your gift there before the altar and first go and be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.

25.verse: Come to terms quickly with your accuser while you are still with him on the way to court, or your accuser may hand you over to the judge, and the judge to the guard, and you be thrown into prison.

26.verse: I tell you the truth, you will certainly not get out of there until you have paid the last penny.

27.verse: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’

28.verse: But I say to you that whoever looks at a woman to lust after her has already committed adultery with her in his heart.

29.verse: If your right eye causes you to sin, gouge it out and throw it away from you, for it is better for you to lose a part of your body than to have your whole body thrown into hell.

30.verse: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away from you; for it is better for you to lose a part of your body than to have your whole body thrown into hell.

31.verse: “And it was said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife, let him give her a written notice of divorce.’

32.verse: But I say to you that anyone who divorces his wife, except on the ground of sexual immorality, makes her commit adultery, and whoever marries a divorced woman is made to commit adultery.

33.verse: “Again, you have heard that it was said to those of old, ‘You shall not break an oath, but carry out the vows you made to the Lord.’

34.verse: But I say to you, do not take an oath at all; neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God,

35.verse: nor by the earth, for it is a footstool for his feet, nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

36.verse: Nor shall you take an oath by your head, because you cannot make a single hair white or black.

37.verse: But let what you say be a simple ‘Yes, Yes,’ or ‘No, No;’ anything more than this comes from the evil one.

38.verse: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’

39.verse: But I say to you, do not resist the evildoer; but whoever slaps you on your right cheek, turn to him the other as well.

40.verse: And let the one who wants to sue you and take your shirt have your coat as well.

41.verse: And whoever compels you to go one mile, go with him two.

42.verse: Give to the one who asks of you, and do not turn down the one who wants to borrow from you.

43.verse: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’

44.verse: But I say to you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,

45.verse: so that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven, for he makes his sun rise on the evil and on the good, and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.

46.verse: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Do not even the tax collectors do the same?

47.verse: And if you greet only your brothers, what are you doing more than others? Do not even the Gentiles do the same?

48.verse: You, however, are to be perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect.

1.verse: “Take care not to perform your good deeds before others so as to be seen by them; otherwise you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.

2.verse: So whenever you give alms do not sound a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, so that they may be praised by others. I tell you the truth, they have received their reward.

3.verse: But when you are giving alms, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,

4.verse: so that your almsgiving may be in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you.

5.verse: “And when you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, for they love to pray standing in synagogues and on street corners that they may be seen by others. I tell you the truth, they have received their reward.

6.verse: But when you pray, go into your room, and shuting your door, pray to your Father who is in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you.

7.verse: “And when you are praying, do not babble on, as the Gentiles do, for they think that they will be heard for their many words.

8.verse: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.

9.verse: Pray then like this: ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be revered,

10.verse: may your kingdom come, may your will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.

11.verse: Give us today our daily bread,

12.verse: and forgive us our sins, as we also forgive those who sin against us.

13.verse: And do not bring us into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one.’

14.verse: “For if you forgive others their offenses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you;

15.verse: but if you do not forgive others their offenses, neither will your Father forgive your offenses.

16.verse: “And when you fast, do not put on a gloomy face as the hypocrites do, for they disfigure their faces so that they will appear to others as fasting; I tell you the truth, they have their reward.

17.verse: But when you fast, anoint your head with oil and wash your face,

18.verse: so that you will not appear to others as fasting, but by your Father who is in secret; and your Father who sees in secret will reward you.

19.verse: “Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal;

20.verse: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroys, and where thieves do not break in and steal.

21.verse: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

22.verse: “The lamp of the body is the eye. If then your eye is healthy, your whole body will be filled with light;

23.verse: but if your eye is evil, your whole body will be filled with darkness. If then the light that is in you is darkness, how great is that darkness!

24.verse: “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and possessions.

25.verse: “Therefore I say to you, ‘Do not be anxious about your life, what you will eat or what you will drink, or about your body, what you will put on. Is not life more than food and the body more than clothing?

26.verse: Look at the birds of the air, they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not more valuable than they?

27.verse: And which of you by being anxious can add a single cubit to his height?

28.verse: And why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they do not toil nor do they spin;

29.verse: but I say to you that not even Solomon in all his royal splendor was clothed like one of these.

30.verse: Now if God so clothes the grass of the field, which is here today but tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will he not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?

31.verse: So then, do not be anxious, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’ or, ‘What shall we drink?’ or, ‘With what shall we clothe ourselves?’—

32.verse: for the Gentiles pursue all these things—for your heavenly Father knows that you need them all.

33.verse: But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.

34.verse: Therefore do not be anxious about tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious about itself. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble.

1.verse: “Do not judge others, so that you will not be judged.

2.verse: For by the standard you judge you will be judged, and with the measure you use it will be measured to you.

3.verse: And why do you look at the speck in your brother’s eye but pay no attention to the log in your own eye?

4.verse: Or how dare you say to your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye,’ and look, there is a log in your own eye?

5.verse: You hypocrite! First take the log out of your own eye, and then you will be able to see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother’s eye.

6.verse: “Do not give what is holy to dogs, and do not throw your pearls in front of pigs, lest the pigs trample them under their feet, and the dogs turn and tear you to pieces.

7.verse: “Ask and it will be given to you, seek and you will find, knock and it will be opened for you.

8.verse: For everyone who asks receives, and everyone who seeks finds, and for everyone who knocks it will be opened.

9.verse: Or is there any man among you who, if his son should ask for bread, would give him a stone?

10.verse: Or if he should ask for a fish, would give him a snake?

11.verse: If then you, who are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask him!

12.verse: “So whatever you would like others to do to you, do also to them, for this is the law and the prophets.

13.verse: “Enter through the narrow gate. For wide is the gate and easy the way that leads to destruction, and many are those who enter through it.

14.verse: How narrow is the gate and difficult the way that leads to life, and few are those who find it!

15.verse: “Beware of false prophets; they come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly are ravenous wolves.

16.verse: By their fruits you will know them. Do people gather grapes from thornbushes, or figs from thistles?

17.verse: So, every healthy tree bears good fruit, but the unhealthy tree bears bad fruit.

18.verse: A healthy tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can an unhealthy tree bear good fruit.

19.verse: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.

20.verse: So then, by their fruits you will know them.

21.verse: “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but the one who does the will of my Father in heaven.

22.verse: On that day many will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and in your name cast out demons, and in your name do many mighty works?’

23.verse: And then will I declare to them, ‘I never knew you; go away from me, you who practice lawlessness.’

24.verse: “Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine, and does them, is like the wise man, who built his house upon rock.

25.verse: When the rain came down, and the waters rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house, it did not collapse because it had been founded on rock.

26.verse: But everyone who hears these words of mine, and does not do them, will be like the foolish man who built his house on sand.

27.verse: When the rain came down, and the waters rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house, it collapsed—and great was its fall!”

28.verse: Now when Jesus had finished these words, the crowds were amazed at his teaching,

29.verse: for he was teaching them as one who had authority, and not as their scribes.

1.verse: When he came down from the mountain, large crowds were following him.

2.verse: A leper came up to him, knelt down, and said, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”

3.verse: Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing; be made clean.” And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

4.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “See that you tell no one; but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”

5.verse: When Jesus entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him and pleaded with him,

6.verse: saying, “Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, suffering terribly.”

7.verse: And Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”

8.verse: But the centurion replied, “Lord, I am not worthy for you to come under my roof, but just say the word and my servant will be healed.

9.verse: For I too am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes, and to my servant, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”

10.verse: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed and said to those who were following, “I tell you the truth, I have not found faith like this in anyone in Israel.

11.verse: I tell you, many will come from the east and west to recline at table with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,

12.verse: but the sons of the kingdom will be cast out into outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”

13.verse: And Jesus said to the centurion, “Go; it will be done for you just as you believed.” And his servant was healed at that very hour.

14.verse: And when Jesus entered Peter’s house, he saw his mother-in-law lying sick with a fever.

15.verse: He touched her hand, and her fever left her. Then she got up and began to serve him.

16.verse: Now when evening came, they brought to him many who were possessed by demons, and he drove out the spirits with a word and healed all who were ill.

17.verse: In this way what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet was fulfilled: “He took our illnesses and carried our diseases.”

18.verse: Now when Jesus saw a crowd around him, he gave orders to go to the other side of the lake.

19.verse: A scribe came to him and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”

20.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have lairs and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”

21.verse: Another of his disciples said to him, “Lord, permit me first to go and bury my father.”

22.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”

23.verse: Then he got into the boat and his disciples followed him.

24.verse: Suddenly a violent storm arose on the sea, so that the boat was being swamped by the waves; but he was asleep.

25.verse: The disciples went to him and woke him, crying out, “Lord, save us! We are perishing!”

26.verse: And he said to them, “Why are you so afraid, you of little faith?” Then he rose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.

27.verse: And the men were amazed and said, “What sort of man is this that even the winds and the sea obey him?”

28.verse: And when he came to the other side, to the region of the Gadarenes, there met him two demoniacs coming out from the tombs. They were so violent that no one could pass by that way.

29.verse: They cried out, “What do you have to do with us, Son of God? Have you come here before the appointed time to torment us?”

30.verse: Some distance from them there was a large herd of pigs feeding.

31.verse: And the demons begged him, saying, “If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”

32.verse: And he said to them, “Be gone.” So they came out and went into the pigs. Then the entire herd rushed down the steep bank into the sea and drowned in the waters.

33.verse: The herdsmen fled, went into the town, and told everything that had happened to the demoniacs.

34.verse: Then the entire town went out to meet Jesus; and when they saw him, they begged him to leave their region.

1.verse: So Jesus got into a boat, crossed to the other side, and went to his own town.

2.verse: And some people brought to him a paralyzed man lying on a stretcher. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Take courage, my son; your sins are forgiven.”

3.verse: At this, some of the scribes said to themselves, “This man is blaspheming.”

4.verse: And Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why are you harboring evil thoughts in your hearts?

5.verse: For which is easier; to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Stand up and walk’?

6.verse: But so you may know that the Son of Man has authority on the earth to forgive sins”—he then said to the paralytic, “Get up, pick up your stretcher, and go to your home.”

7.verse: So he got up and went to his home.

8.verse: When the crowds saw it, they were struck with awe and glorified God who had given such authority to men.

9.verse: As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax booth, and he said to him, “Follow me.” So Matthew got up and followed him.

10.verse: And as Jesus sat at table in the house, many tax collectors and sinners came and were eating with Jesus and his disciples.

11.verse: When the Pharisees saw this, they said to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

12.verse: But when Jesus heard it, he said, “Those who are well have no need of a doctor, but those who are sick.

13.verse: Go and learn what this means, ‘I desire mercy, not sacrifice.’ For I did not come to call the pious, but sinners, to repentance.”

14.verse: Then the disciples of John came to him and asked, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast regularly, but your disciples do not fast?”

15.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Certainly the wedding guests can’t mourn as long as the bridegroom is still with them? The days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast!

16.verse: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, because the patch will pull away from the garment, and the tear will be worse.

17.verse: Neither is new wine poured into old wineskins. If that happens, the wineskins split, the wine pours out, and the wineskins are ruined. Instead, new wine is put into fresh wineskins, and so both are preserved.”

18.verse: As he was saying these things to them, a ruler came and bowed down before him, saying, “My daughter has just died; but come, lay your hand on her and she will live again.”

19.verse: So Jesus got up and followed him, and so did his disciples.

20.verse: Just then a woman who had suffered from severe bleeding for twelve years came up behind him and touched the fringe of his cloak,

21.verse: for she was saying to herself, “If I can only touch his garment, I will be healed.”

22.verse: And when Jesus turned and saw her, he said, “Take courage, my daughter; your faith has made you well.” And the woman was healed from that hour.

23.verse: When Jesus arrived at the ruler’s house and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd,

24.verse: he said, “Leave now, for the girl is not dead but only sleeping.” And they began to ridicule him.

25.verse: But when the crowd had been removed, Jesus went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose.

26.verse: And the report of this spread through all that region.

27.verse: And as Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him, calling out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”

28.verse: When he had gone into the house, the blind men came to him; and Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?” They said to him, “Yes, Lord.”

29.verse: Then he touched their eyes and said, “According to your faith may it be done to you.”

30.verse: And their eyes were opened. Then Jesus sternly charged them, “See that no one knows about this.”

31.verse: But they went out and spread the news about him throughout that entire region.

32.verse: As they were going away, others brought to him a man who could not speak and was demon-possessed.

33.verse: And when the demon had been driven out, the man who had been mute began to speak. The crowds were amazed and said, “Never has anything like this been seen in Israel.”

34.verse: But the Pharisees kept saying, “It is by the ruler of demons that he drives out demons.”

35.verse: And Jesus went throughout all their cities and towns, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness.

36.verse: And when he saw the crowds, he had compassion on them, because they were distressed and dejected, like sheep without a shepherd.

37.verse: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is great but the workers are few;

38.verse: so pray to the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest.”

1.verse: Jesus gathered his twelve disciples and gave them authority over unclean spirits so that they could drive them out and heal every kind of disease and sickness.

2.verse: These are the names of the twelve apostles: first, Simon, who is called Peter, then Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;

3.verse: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;

4.verse: Simon the Cananaean, and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.

5.verse: These twelve Jesus sent out after instructing them as follows: “Do not go among the Gentiles and do not enter any Samaritan town;

6.verse: but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

7.verse: As you go, proclaim the message, saying, ‘The kingdom of heaven is at hand.’

8.verse: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse the lepers, drive out demons. Freely you received, freely give.

9.verse: Do not take gold, or silver, or copper in your money belts,

10.verse: or a bag for your journey, or two tunics, or sandals, or a staff; for the worker deserves his keep.

11.verse: And whatever town or village you enter, find out who in it is worthy and stay there until you leave.

12.verse: And when you enter a house, give it your greeting.

13.verse: If the household is worthy, let your greeting of peace come upon it; but if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.

14.verse: And if anyone will not receive you or listen to your message, as you leave that house or that town shake off the dust from your feet.

15.verse: I tell you the truth, it will be more bearable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that town.

16.verse: “Behold, I am sending you out as sheep in the midst of wolves; so be shrewd as serpents and innocent as doves.

17.verse: And beware of men, for they will hand you over to the courts, and they will flog you in their synagogues;

18.verse: and you will be brought before governors and kings for my sake, as a testimony to them and to the Gentiles.

19.verse: But when they hand you over, do not worry about how you are to speak or what you are to say; for what you are to say will be given to you at that time.

20.verse: For it will not be you speaking but the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.

21.verse: “Brother will hand over brother to death, and a father his child, and children will rise up against parents and have them put to death.

22.verse: And you will be hated by all on account of my name. But the one who endures to the end, this one will be saved.

23.verse: When they persecute you in one town, flee to another; for I tell you the truth, you will not finish going through all the towns of Israel before the Son of Man comes.

24.verse: “A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his master.

25.verse: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his teacher, and the servant as his master. If they have called the head of the house ‘Beelzebul,’ how much more will they revile the members of his household!

26.verse: “Therefore do not be afraid of them; for there is nothing covered that will not be uncovered, and hidden that will not be made known.

27.verse: What I say to you in the darkness, speak in the light; and what you hear in the ear proclaim from the housetops.

28.verse: Do not be afraid of those who can kill the body but cannot kill the soul. Rather, fear the one who can destroy both soul and body in hell.

29.verse: Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? Yet not one of them will fall to the ground apart from your Father.

30.verse: But even the hairs of your head have all been counted.

31.verse: So do not be afraid; you are of greater value than many sparrows.

32.verse: So everyone who will acknowledge me before others, I will acknowledge him before my Father who is in heaven;

33.verse: but whoever disowns me before others, I will disown him before my Father who is in heaven.

34.verse: “Do not think that I have come to bring peace to the earth. I did not come to bring peace, but a sword.

35.verse: For I came to turn a man against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law;

36.verse: and a man’s enemies will be members of his own household.

37.verse: Whoever loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me, and whoever loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.

38.verse: And whoever does not take up his cross and follow me is not worthy of me.

39.verse: Whoever finds his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.

40.verse: “Whoever receives you receives me, and whoever receives me receives the one who sent me.

41.verse: Whoever welcomes a prophet because he is a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward, and whoever welcomes a righteous person because he is a righteous person will receive a righteous person’s reward.

42.verse: And whoever, because he is a disciple, gives one of these little ones even a cup of cold water to drink, I tell you the truth, he will by no means lose his reward.”

1.verse: Now when Jesus had finished giving instructions to his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and proclaim his message in their towns.

2.verse: Now when John heard in prison about the works of the Messiah, he sent word through his disciples,

3.verse: asking him, “Are you the one who is to come, or should we wait for someone else?”

4.verse: And Jesus answered them, saying, “Go and tell John what you hear and see:

5.verse: the blind receive their sight and the lame walk, lepers are cleansed and the deaf hear, the dead are raised and the poor are being told the good news.

6.verse: And blessed is the one who does not stumble because of me.”

7.verse: As they went away, Jesus began to speak to the crowds about John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to look at? A reed shaken by the wind?

8.verse: What then did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in the courts of kings.

9.verse: What then did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.

10.verse: This is the one about whom it stands written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.’

11.verse: “I tell you the truth, there has not risen among those born of women anyone greater than John the Baptist; yet the one who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

12.verse: From the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven has suffered violence, and the violent are taking it by force.

13.verse: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John;

14.verse: and if you are willing to accept it, he is Elijah who is to come.

15.verse: He who has ears, let him hear!

16.verse: “To what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces who cry to their friends,

17.verse: ‘We played the flute for you, and you did not dance; we sang a dirge, and you did not mourn.’

18.verse: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon!’

19.verse: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Look at him! A glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ Yet wisdom is shown to be right by what she does.”

20.verse: Then he began to reprimand the towns in which most of his mighty works had been done, because they did not repent:

21.verse: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if in Tyre and Sidon had been done the mighty works that were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

22.verse: Nevertheless I tell you, it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.

23.verse: And as for you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? No, you will be brought down to Hades! For if in Sodom had been done the mighty works that were done in you, it would have remained to this day.

24.verse: Nevertheless I tell you that it will be more bearable for the land of Sodom on the day of judgment than for you.”

25.verse: At that time Jesus declared, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and clever and revealed them to little children;

26.verse: yes, Father, for such was your gracious will.

27.verse: All things were handed over to me by my Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father; neither does anyone know the Father except the Son and the one to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.

28.verse: Come to me, all you who are weary and carrying heavy burdens, and I will refresh you.

29.verse: Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.

30.verse: For my yoke is easy and my burden is light.”

1.verse: At that time Jesus went through the grainfields on the Sabbath; and his disciples were hungry, and they began to pluck heads of grain and eat.

2.verse: But when the Pharisees saw this, they said to him, “Look, your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on a Sabbath.”

3.verse: But he said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he and those with him were hungry,

4.verse: how he entered the house of God and they ate the sacred bread, which it was not lawful for him to eat nor for those who were with him, but for the priests alone?

5.verse: Or have you not read in the law that on the Sabbath the priests in the temple break the Sabbath and yet are not guilty?

6.verse: But I say to you that something greater than the temple is here.

7.verse: And if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the guiltless.

8.verse: For the Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”

9.verse: Then he left that place and went into their synagogue,

10.verse: and there he saw a man with a withered hand. And they asked him, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”—so they might have a charge to bring against him.

11.verse: But he said to them, “What man is there among you who has only one sheep, and if it falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will he not take hold of it and lift it out?

12.verse: How much more valuable then is a man than a sheep! So then, it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”

13.verse: Then he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And the man stretched it out, and it was restored, sound like the other.

14.verse: Then the Pharisees went and plotted against him in order that they might put him to death.

15.verse: But Jesus, aware of this, withdrew from there. And large crowds followed him, and he healed them all.

16.verse: And he sternly warned them that they should not make him known

17.verse: so that what was written by Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled:

18.verse: “Here is my servant whom I have chosen, my beloved with whom my soul is well pleased. I will put my Spirit upon him, and he will proclaim justice to the nations.

19.verse: He will not quarrel, nor will he cry out, nor will anyone hear his voice in the streets.

20.verse: A shattered reed he will not break, and a smoldering wick he will not snuff out, until he brings justice to victory.

21.verse: And in his name the nations will put their hope.”

22.verse: Then a blind and mute demoniac was brought to him, and he healed him so that the mute could both speak and see.

23.verse: And all the crowds were astonished and were saying, “Could this be the Son of David?”

24.verse: But when the Pharisees heard this, they said, “This fellow does not cast out demons except by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons.”

25.verse: But he knew their thoughts and said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to ruin, and no city or house divided against itself will stand.

26.verse: So if Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself; how then will his kingdom stand?

27.verse: And if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons cast them out? For this reason they will be your judges.

28.verse: But if I cast out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.

29.verse: Or how can someone enter the strong man’s house and carry off his belongings, unless he first ties up the strong man? And then he will ransack his house.

30.verse: The one who is not with me is against me, and the one who does not gather with me scatters.

31.verse: “For this reason I say to you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven people, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven.

32.verse: And whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, neither in this age nor in the age to come.

33.verse: “Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree rotten and its fruit rotten; for the tree is known by its fruit.

34.verse: You offspring of snakes! How can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.

35.verse: The good man brings good things out of his good treasure, and the evil man brings evil things out of his evil treasure.

36.verse: But I say to you that on the day of judgment, people will give an account for every careless word they speak.

37.verse: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”

38.verse: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees answered him, saying, “Teacher, we wish to see a sign from you.”

39.verse: But he answered them, “An evil and adulterous generation asks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah the prophet.

40.verse: For just as Jonah was in the belly of the great fish for three days and three nights, so will the Son of Man be in the heart of the earth for three days and three nights.

41.verse: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and look, something greater than Jonah is here!

42.verse: The queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and look, something greater than Solomon is here!

43.verse: “When an unclean spirit comes out of a person, it wanders through waterless regions in search of a resting place, but finds none.

44.verse: Then it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’ And when it arrives, it finds the house unoccupied, swept, and put in order.

45.verse: Then it goes and brings along with it seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they enter and settle down there; and the last state of that person turns out to be worse than the first. So will it be for this evil generation as well.”

46.verse: While he was still speaking to the people, his mother and his brothers stood outside, wanting to speak to him.

47.verse: And someone said to him, “Look, your mother and your brothers are standing outside, waiting to speak with you.”

48.verse: But he answered, saying to the one who had told him, “Who is my mother? And who are my brothers?”

49.verse: And stretching out his hand toward his disciples, he said, “Look, here are my mother and my brothers!

50.verse: For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven, he is my brother and sister and mother.”

1.verse: That same day Jesus went out of the house and was sitting by the sea.

2.verse: And great crowds gathered around him so that he got into a boat and sat down, and all the crowd stood on the beach.

3.verse: And he told them many things in parables, saying: “A sower went out to sow.

4.verse: And as he sowed, some seeds fell along the path, and the birds came and devoured them.

5.verse: Other seed fell on rocky places, where it did not have much soil; and immediately it sprouted because it had no depth of soil.

6.verse: But when the sun came up it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

7.verse: Other seed fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it.

8.verse: Other seed fell on good soil and produced grain, some a hundredfold, some sixty, and some thirty.

9.verse: He who has ears, let him hear!”

10.verse: And the disciples came to him and said, “Why do you speak to them in parables?”

11.verse: He answered them, saying, “Because to you it has been given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it has not been given.

12.verse: For to the one who has, more will be given, and he will have an abundance; but from the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away.

13.verse: This is why I speak to them in parables, because seeing they do not see and hearing they do not hear nor do they understand.

14.verse: And in them the prophecy of Isaiah is being fulfilled that says: ‘You will surely hear but never understand, and you will surely see but never perceive.

15.verse: For the heart of this people has become dull, and with their ears they scarcely hear, and their eyes they have closed, lest they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears and understand with their hearts and turn, and I would heal them.’

16.verse: But blessed are your eyes, because they see, and your ears, because they hear.

17.verse: I tell you the truth, many prophets and righteous people longed to see the things you are seeing but did not see them, and to hear the things you are hearing but did not hear them.

18.verse: “Hear then the parable of the sower:

19.verse: When anyone hears the message of the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away that which was sown in his heart. This is what was sown along the path.

20.verse: As for the one who was sown on rocky places, this is the one who hears the message and immediately receives it with joy;

21.verse: yet he has no root in himself but lasts only a short time, and when suffering or persecution arises on account of the message, immediately he falls away.

22.verse: As for the one who was sown among thorns, this is the one who hears the message, but worldly anxiety and the deception of wealth choke the message and it becomes unfruitful.

23.verse: As for the one who was sown on good soil, this is the one who hears the message and understands it, who indeed bears fruit and produces, some a hundredfold, some sixty, and some thirty.”

24.verse: Jesus put another parable before them, saying: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man sowing good seed in his field.

25.verse: But while everyone was sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat and went away.

26.verse: When the plants came up and bore grain, then the weeds appeared as well.

27.verse: And the servants of the master of the house came and said to him, ‘Sir, did you not sow good seed in your field? Why then does it have weeds?’

28.verse: And he said to them, ‘An enemy has done this!’ And the servants said to him, ‘So do you want us to go and gather them?’

29.verse: But he replied, ‘No, lest in gathering the weeds you uproot the wheat along with them.

30.verse: Let both grow together until the harvest; and at harvest time I will tell the harvesters, “First gather the weeds and bind them into bundles to be burned, then gather the wheat into my barn.”’”

31.verse: He gave them another parable, saying: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his field.

32.verse: It is the smallest of all the seeds; but when it is grown, it is larger than all the garden plants and becomes a tree so that the birds of the air come and nest in its branches.”

33.verse: He spoke another parable to them: “The kingdom of heaven is like leaven, which a woman took and put into three measures of flour, until it was all leavened.”

34.verse: All these things Jesus spoke to the crowds in parables, and without a parable he told them nothing;

35.verse: so that what was spoken by the prophet might be fulfilled, saying, “I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things kept secret from the foundation of the world.”

36.verse: Then he left the crowds and went into the house. And his disciples came to him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds in the field.”

37.verse: And he answered, saying, “The one who sows the good seed is the Son of Man;

38.verse: and the field is the world; and as for the good seed, these are the sons of the kingdom; and the weeds are the sons of the evil one;

39.verse: and the enemy who sowed them is the devil; and the harvest is the end of the age; and the harvesters are the angels.

40.verse: Therefore just as the weeds are gathered and burned in the fire, so it will be at the end of the age.

41.verse: The Son of Man will send his angels, and they will gather out of his kingdom everything that causes sin and those who break his laws.

42.verse: And they will throw them into the fiery furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

43.verse: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He who has ears, let him hear!

44.verse: “The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field that a man found and covered up. Then in his joy he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.

45.verse: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant searching for fine pearls;

46.verse: and when he found one pearl of great value, he went away and sold all that he had and bought it.

47.verse: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was cast into the sea and caught fish of every kind;

48.verse: and when it was full, they pulled it up onto the shore; and they sat down and put the good fish into baskets, but the bad they threw away.

49.verse: So it will be at the end of the age; the angels will go out and separate the wicked from the righteous

50.verse: and cast them into the fiery furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

51.verse: “Have you understood all these things?” They said to him, “Yes.”

52.verse: And he said to them, “Therefore every scribe who has become a disciple in the kingdom of heaven is like the master of a house who brings out of his treasure things new and old.”

53.verse: Now when Jesus had finished these parables, he moved on from there.

54.verse: And upon arriving at his hometown, he taught them in their synagogue so that they were amazed and said, “Where did this man get such wisdom and miraculous powers?

55.verse: Is not this the carpenter’s son? Is not his mother called Mary, and his brothers James and Joseph and Simon and Judas?

56.verse: And his sisters, are they not all with us? Where then did this man get all these things?”

57.verse: And they were deeply offended at him. But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown and in his own household.”

58.verse: And he did not do many miracles there because of their unbelief.

1.verse: About that time Herod the tetrarch heard the report about Jesus.

2.verse: And he said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist; he has risen from the dead; and that is why miraculous powers are at work in him.”

3.verse: For Herod had arrested John, bound him, and put him in prison because of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip;

4.verse: because John had been telling him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”

5.verse: And though Herod wanted to put him to death, he feared the people because they considered him to be a prophet.

6.verse: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod.

7.verse: So he promised with an oath to give her whatever she asked.

8.verse: Prompted by her mother, she said, “Give me the head of John the Baptist here on a platter.”

9.verse: And although the king was distressed, because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he commanded it to be given to her.

10.verse: So he sent and had John beheaded in the prison.

11.verse: And his head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.

12.verse: John’s disciples came and took the corpse and buried it; then they went and told Jesus.

13.verse: Now when Jesus heard about John, he left there by boat to a deserted place to be alone; but when the crowds heard about it, they followed him on foot from the towns.

14.verse: And when he came ashore, he saw a great crowd; and he had compassion on them and healed their sick.

15.verse: When evening came, the disciples approached him, saying, “This is a deserted place and the hour is now late; send the crowds away so they can go into the villages and buy food for themselves.”

16.verse: But Jesus said to them, “They have no need to go away; you give them something to eat.”

17.verse: And they said to him, “We have nothing here but five loaves and two fish.”

18.verse: And he said, “Bring them here to me.”

19.verse: Then he ordered the crowds to sit down on the grass, and taking the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven, said a blessing, and broke the loaves. He gave the loaves to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.

20.verse: And they all ate and were filled; and they picked up what remained of the broken pieces, twelve baskets full.

21.verse: Not counting women and children, there were about five thousand men who had eaten.

22.verse: Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to the opposite shore, until he had dismissed the crowds.

23.verse: And after sending the crowds away, he went up on the mountainside by himself to pray; and when evening came, he was there alone.

24.verse: Meanwhile the boat, already far from land, was being tossed by the waves, for the wind was against it.

25.verse: And in the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea.

26.verse: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were frightened and said, “It is a ghost!” And they cried out in fear.

27.verse: But right away Jesus spoke to them, saying, “Take courage, it is I! Do not be afraid.”

28.verse: And Peter answered him, saying, “Lord, if it is you, tell me to come to you on the water.”

29.verse: And he said, “Come!” So Peter got out of the boat, stepped out on the water and headed toward Jesus.

30.verse: But when he realized that the wind was blustery, he became afraid; and starting to sink, he cried out, “Lord, save me!”

31.verse: And immediately Jesus reached out his hand, took hold of him, and said to him, “O you of little faith, why did you doubt?”

32.verse: And when they got into the boat, the wind died down.

33.verse: And those in the boat worshiped him, saying, “Truly you are the Son of God.”

34.verse: And when they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret.

35.verse: When the men of that place recognized him, they sent word into all that surrounding area and brought to him all who were sick.

36.verse: And they begged him that they might just touch the fringe of his cloak; and as many as touched it were healed.

1.verse: Then Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem, saying,

2.verse: “Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands when they eat bread.”

3.verse: But he answered them, saying, “And why do you break the commandment of God for the sake of your tradition?

4.verse: For God said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever speaks evil of his father or mother must be put to death.’

5.verse: But you say, ‘Whoever says to his father or his mother, “Whatever benefit you might have received from me is a gift to God,”

6.verse: he need not honor his father.’ So you have nullified the word of God for the sake of your tradition.

7.verse: You hypocrites! Well did Isaiah prophesy about you, when he said:

8.verse: ‘This people honors me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.

9.verse: And in vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”

10.verse: And he called the crowd to him and said to them, “Hear and understand:

11.verse: It is not what goes into the mouth that defiles a person, but what comes out of the mouth; this defiles a person.”

12.verse: Then the disciples came and said to him, “Do you know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard what you said?”

13.verse: And he answered, saying, “Every plant that my heavenly Father did not plant will be rooted up.

14.verse: Leave them be! They are blind guides. And if a blind man guides a blind man, both will fall into a pit.”

15.verse: Then Peter answered him, saying, “Explain this parable to us.”

16.verse: And he said, “Are you without understanding even now?

17.verse: Do you not understand that everything that goes into the mouth passes through the stomach and is expelled into the latrine?

18.verse: But the things that go out of the mouth come from the heart, and these defile the person.

19.verse: For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false witness, slander.

20.verse: These are the things that defile a person, but to eat with unwashed hands does not defile a person.”

21.verse: And leaving there, Jesus withdrew into the region of Tyre and Sidon.

22.verse: And a Canaanite woman from that region came out and began to shout, saying, “Have mercy on me, O Lord, Son of David; my daughter is horribly demon-possessed.”

23.verse: But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and urged him, saying, “Send her away, because she keeps shouting after us.”

24.verse: But he answered, saying, “I was not sent except to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”

25.verse: Then she came and knelt before him, saying, “Lord, help me!”

26.verse: And he answered, “It is not right to take bread from the children and toss it to the dogs.”

27.verse: “Yes, Lord,” she said, “but even the dogs feed on the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”

28.verse: Then Jesus answered, saying to her, “O woman, great is your faith! What you desire will be done for you.” And her daughter was healed from that hour.

29.verse: After Jesus left from there, he passed by the Sea of Galilee and went up on the mountain where he sat down.

30.verse: And great crowds came to him, bringing with them those who were lame, blind, crippled, mute, and many others; and they put them down at his feet and he healed them.

31.verse: So the crowd was astonished when they saw the mute speaking, the crippled restored, the lame walking, and the blind seeing, and they praised the God of Israel.

32.verse: Then Jesus called his disciples to him and said, “I have compassion on the crowd because they have already been with me three days and have nothing to eat; and I do not want to send them away hungry, lest they faint from exhaustion on the way.”

33.verse: And the disciples said to him, “Where in such a desolate place could we find enough bread to feed so great a crowd?”

34.verse: And Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?” And they said, “Seven, and a few little fish.”

35.verse: And instructing the crowd to sit down on the ground,

36.verse: he took the seven loaves and the fish: and when he had given thanks, he broke them and began distributing them to the disciples, and the disciples to the crowds.

37.verse: And they all ate and were filled; and they picked up what was left over of the broken pieces, seven large baskets full.

38.verse: Not counting women and children, there were four thousand men who had eaten.

39.verse: And when he had sent the crowds away, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.

1.verse: Now when the Pharisees and Sadducees came to test Jesus, they asked him to show them a sign from heaven.

2.verse: And he answered them, saying, “When evening comes, you say, ‘The weather will be fair, for the sky is red’;

3.verse: and in the morning, ‘It will be stormy today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ You know how to interpret the appearance of the sky, but you are not able to evaluate the signs of the times?

4.verse: An evil and adulterous generation looks for a sign, but no sign will be given it except the sign of Jonah.” Then he left them and went away.

5.verse: The disciples arrived at the other side but had forgotten to take any bread.

6.verse: Jesus said to them, “Watch out, and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

7.verse: And they began to discuss this among themselves, saying, “It is because we brought no bread.”

8.verse: But when Jesus became aware of this, he said, “O you of little faith, why are you discussing among yourselves the fact that you have no bread?

9.verse: Do you not yet understand? Do you not remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you gathered?

10.verse: Or the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many baskets you gathered?

11.verse: How is it that you do not understand that I was not speaking to you about bread? Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”

12.verse: Then they understood that he had not told them to beware of the leaven of bread but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

13.verse: Now when Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”

14.verse: And they said, “Some say John the Baptist, others Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”

15.verse: He said to them, “But you, who do you say that I am?”

16.verse: And Simon Peter answered, saying, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”

17.verse: And Jesus responded, saying to him, “Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, because flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but my Father in heaven.

18.verse: And I say to you, you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not overpower it.

19.verse: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will have been loosed in heaven.”

20.verse: Then he ordered his disciples to tell no one that he was the Messiah

21.verse: From that time Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders and ruling priests and scribes, and be killed, and on the third day be raised.

22.verse: And Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him, saying, “Far be it from you, Lord! This must never happen to you.”

23.verse: But Jesus turned and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are an obstacle in my way, because you are not thinking the thoughts of God but those of men.”

24.verse: Then Jesus told his disciples, “If anyone resolves to come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.

25.verse: For whoever resolves to save his life will lose it; but whoever loses his life for my sake will find it.

26.verse: For what advantage will there be for a person if he gains the whole world yet forfeits his life? Or what will a person give in exchange for his life?

27.verse: For the Son of Man is to come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then he will repay each person according to his conduct.

28.verse: I tell you the truth, there are some of those standing here who will not taste death until they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.

1.verse: Six days later Jesus took Peter and James and John his brother, and led them up a very high mountain by themselves.

2.verse: And he was transfigured before them, and his face shone like the sun, and his clothes became white as light.

3.verse: Suddenly there appeared to them Moses and Elijah, talking with him.

4.verse: And Peter spoke to Jesus, saying, “Lord, it is good that we are here. If you wish, I will put up three shelters here—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

5.verse: While he was still speaking, a bright cloud overshadowed them and a voice from the cloud said, “This is my Son, the Beloved, in whom I am well pleased; listen to him!”

6.verse: And when the disciples heard this, they were overcome with fear and fell on their faces.

7.verse: But Jesus came over and touched them, saying, “Rise, and do not be afraid.”

8.verse: And when they raised their eyes, they saw no one except Jesus himself alone.

9.verse: And as they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, “Tell the vision to no one until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.”

10.verse: And the disciples asked him, saying, “Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

11.verse: He answered, saying, “To be sure, Elijah does come, and he will restore all things.

12.verse: And I tell you that Elijah has come already, and they did not recognize him, but did to him whatever they wished. So also the Son of Man will suffer at their hands.”

13.verse: Then the disciples understood that he had spoken to them about John the Baptist.

14.verse: When they returned to the crowd, a man approached Jesus, knelt before him,

15.verse: and said, “Lord, take pity on my son, because he is an epileptic and suffers terribly; for he often falls into the fire and often into the water.

16.verse: And I brought him to your disciples but they could not heal him.”

17.verse: Jesus answered, saying, “O unbelieving and perverse generation, how long am I to be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him here to me.”

18.verse: Then Jesus rebuked the demon and it came out of him; and the boy was healed from that hour.

19.verse: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why could we not cast it out?”

20.verse: He said to them, “Because of the poverty of your faith. I tell you the truth, if you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.”

21.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

22.verse: While they were still together in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is about to be delivered into the hands of men,

23.verse: and they will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised.” And they were greatly distressed.

24.verse: And when they arrived at Capernaum, the collectors of the temple tax came to Peter and said, “Does your teacher not pay the two-drachma tax?”

25.verse: “Yes,” he answered. And when he went into the house, Jesus spoke to Peter first, saying, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do earthly kings collect tolls or taxes—from their sons or from outsiders?”

26.verse: And when he answered, “From outsiders,” Jesus said to him, “Then the sons are exempt.

27.verse: But lest we offend them, go to the sea, cast in a hook, and take the first fish that comes up. When you have opened its mouth, you will find a four drachma coin; take it and give it to them for me and you.”

1.verse: At that time the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Who then is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”

2.verse: Jesus invited a child to come to him, and placing him in their midst,

3.verse: said, “I tell you the truth, unless you change and become like children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven!

4.verse: For whoever humbles himself as this child is greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

5.verse: And whoever welcomes a child like this in my name welcomes me.

6.verse: But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him to have a large millstone hung around his neck and be drowned far out at sea.

7.verse: Woe to the world because of the things that cause people to sin! It is inevitable that such things come, but woe to the one through whom they come!

8.verse: “If your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away; it is better for you to enter life crippled or lame than with two hands or two feet to be thrown into eternal fire.

9.verse: And if your eye causes you to sin, gouge it out and throw it away; it is better for you to enter life with one eye than with two eyes to be thrown into the hell of fire.

10.verse: “See that you do not despise one of these little ones. For I tell you that their angels in heaven always see the face of my Father who is in heaven.

11.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

12.verse: What do you think? If a man has a hundred sheep and one of them goes astray, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the slopes and go in search of the one that has wandered off?

13.verse: And if he finds it, I tell you the truth, he will rejoice over it more than over the ninety-nine that did not go astray.

14.verse: In the same way, it is not the will of your Father in heaven that even one of these little ones should perish.

15.verse: “If your brother sins, go and point out his fault between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have won back your brother.

16.verse: But if he does not listen, take one or two others with you so that every matter may be confirmed on the evidence of two or three witnesses.

17.verse: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church; and if he refuses to listen even to the church, you are to treat him as a pagan and a tax collector.

18.verse: “I tell you the truth, whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will have been loosed in heaven.

19.verse: “Again, I tell you the truth, if two of you on earth are in agreement about anything whatever you may ask, it will be done for you by my Father who is in heaven.

20.verse: For where two or three are gathered in my name, I am there in their midst.”

21.verse: Then Peter came to Jesus and said, “Lord, how often must I forgive my brother when he sins against me? Up to seven times?”

22.verse: Jesus said to him, “I do not say to you, up to seven times, but up to seventy times seven.

23.verse: Therefore the kingdom of heaven is like a king who decided to settle accounts with his servants.

24.verse: And when he had begun to settle them, a man who owed ten thousand talents was brought to him.

25.verse: And since he did not have the means to repay the debt, his master commanded that he be sold along with his wife and children and everything he had, and that payment be made.

26.verse: So the servant fell to the ground prostate before him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will repay you everything.’

27.verse: Moved with compassion, the master of that servant released him and forgave him the debt.

28.verse: But that same servant then went out and found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denarii; and seizing him by the throat began to choke him, saying, ‘Pay back what you owe.’

29.verse: Therefore his fellow servant fell to the ground and pleaded with him, saying ‘Have patience with me, and I will repay you.’

30.verse: But he refused. Instead, he went and threw him in prison until he should pay back the debt.

31.verse: So when his fellow servants saw what had happened, they became indignant and went and told their master all that had taken place.

32.verse: Then his master called him in and said to him, ‘You wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt because you pleaded with me.

33.verse: And should not you also have had mercy on your fellow servant, even as I had mercy on you?’

34.verse: And in anger his master handed him over to the prison guards to torture him until he should pay back all he owed.

35.verse: So also will my heavenly Father do to you, unless you each forgive your brother from your heart.”

1.verse: Now when Jesus had finished these sayings, he left Galilee and went to the region of Judea beyond the Jordan River.

2.verse: Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.

3.verse: Some Pharisees came to him and tested him by asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any cause?”

4.verse: He answered, saying, “Have you not read that he who created them from the beginning ‘made them male and female?’”

5.verse: And he added, “For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two will become one flesh.’

6.verse: So then they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, no one must separate.”

7.verse: “Why then,” they asked, “did Moses command that a certificate of divorce be given before she be sent away?”

8.verse: Jesus replied to them, “Moses allowed you to divorce your wives because of the hardness of your hearts; but it was not that way from the beginning.

9.verse: But I say to you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery.”

10.verse: The disciples said to him, “If such is the case of a man with his wife, it is better not to marry.”

11.verse: Jesus replied to them, “Not everyone can accept this statement, but only those to whom it is given.

12.verse: For there are eunuchs who have been that way from their mother’s womb, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by others, and there are eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. The one who is able to accept this should accept it.”

13.verse: Then children were brought to Jesus so that he might lay his hands on them and pray, but the disciples rebuked those who brought them.

14.verse: But Jesus said, “Let the children come to me and do not try to prevent them, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”

15.verse: And he placed his hands on them and went on his way.

16.verse: A young man came up to Jesus and asked, “Teacher, what good thing must I do so that I may have eternal life?”
