17.verse: And Jesus replied to him, “Why do you ask me about what is good? There is only one who is good. If you want to enter life, keep the commandments.”

18.verse: “Which ones?” he inquired. And Jesus said, “‘Do not murder, Do not commit adultery, Do not steal, Do not give false testimony,

19.verse: Honor your father and mother, and, Love your neighbor as yourself.”

20.verse: The young man said to him, “All these I have kept. What do I still lack?”

21.verse: Jesus said to him, “If you want to be perfect, go and sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; then come, follow me.”

22.verse: But when the young man heard this, he went away greatly distressed, for he had many possessions.

23.verse: And Jesus said to his disciples, “I tell you the truth, only with difficulty will a rich person enter the kingdom of heaven.

24.verse: Again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.”

25.verse: When the disciples heard this, they were greatly astounded and said, “Who then can be saved?”

26.verse: Jesus looked straight at them and said, “With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”

27.verse: Then Peter responded, saying to him, “See, we have left everything and followed you. What then will there be for us?”

28.verse: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth that in the new age, when the Son of Man is seated on his glorious throne, you who have followed me will also sit on twelve thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

29.verse: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or lands for my name’s sake will receive a hundredfold and will inherit eternal life.

30.verse: But many will be first who were last, and last who were first.

1.verse: “For the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of an estate who went out early in the morning to hire men to work in his vineyard.

2.verse: After having agreed with the workers for a denarius per day, he sent them into his vineyard.

3.verse: And going out about the third hour, he saw others standing in the marketplace with nothing to do.

4.verse: And to them he said, “You go into the vineyard as well, and whatever is fair I will pay you.’

5.verse: So they went off. When he went out again about the sixth hour and the ninth hour, he did the same thing.

6.verse: And about the eleventh hour, when he had gone out and found others standing around, he said to them, ‘Why have you been standing here idle all day long?’

7.verse: They said to him, ‘Because no one has hired us.’ He said to them, ‘You go into the vineyard too.’

8.verse: And when evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, ‘Call the workers and pay them their wages, beginning with the last and going back to the first.’

9.verse: Those hired about the eleventh hour came and each received a denarius.

10.verse: When those who were hired first came, they thought they would receive more; but they also each received a denarius.

11.verse: And when they received it, they began to grumble against the owner of the estate,

12.verse: saying, ‘These last worked but one hour, and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden of the day and the scorching heat.’

13.verse: But he answered one of them, saying, ‘Friend, I am not being unfair to you. Did you not agree with me to work for a denarius?

14.verse: Take what is yours and be gone. I choose to give to this last man the same as I give to you.

15.verse: Am I not allowed to do what I choose with what belongs to me? Or are you envious because I am generous?’

16.verse: So the last will be first, and the first will be last.”

17.verse: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside and said to them on the way,

18.verse: “We are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the ruling priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death,

19.verse: hand him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and flogged and crucified, and on the third day he will be raised.”

20.verse: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to Jesus with her sons, and kneeling down she asked something from him.

21.verse: And he said to her, “What do you wish?” She said to him, “Grant that these two sons of mine may sit, one at your right hand and one at your left, in your kingdom.”

22.verse: Jesus answered, saying, “You do not realize what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink?” They said to him, “We are able.”

23.verse: He said to them, “My cup you will drink, but to sit at my right hand and at my left is not mine to grant, but it is for those for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”

24.verse: When the ten heard this, they were indignant with the two brothers.

25.verse: But Jesus called them to him and said, “You know that the rulers of the nations lord it over them, and their leaders exercise authority over them.

26.verse: It will not be so among you. But whoever would be great among you must be your servant,

27.verse: and whoever would be first among you must be your servant;

28.verse: just as the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life a ransom for many.”

29.verse: As they were going out of Jericho, a large crowd followed him.

30.verse: Two blind men were sitting beside the road, and when they heard that Jesus was passing by they cried out, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”

31.verse: The crowd rebuked them and told them to be quiet, but they cried out all the louder, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”

32.verse: Jesus stopped and called them, saying, “What do you want me to do for you?”

33.verse: They said to him, “Lord, let our eyes be opened.”

34.verse: Moved with compassion, Jesus touched their eyes. Immediately they received their sight and followed him.

1.verse: Now when they drew near to Jerusalem and came to Bethphage, to the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,

2.verse: saying to them, “Go into the village ahead of you, and right away you will find a donkey tethered, and a colt with her. Untie them and bring them to me.

3.verse: If anyone says anything to you, you are to say, ‘The Lord has need of them.’ And he will send them at once.”

4.verse: This took place in order that what had been spoken by the prophet might be fulfilled, saying,

5.verse: “Say to the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold, your king is coming to you, humble and mounted on a donkey, and on a colt, the foal of a beast of burden.’”

6.verse: So the disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed them.

7.verse: They brought the donkey and the colt, and placed their cloaks on them; and he sat on them.

8.verse: A very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from trees and spread them on the road.

9.verse: The crowds that went before him and those that followed were shouting, “Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

10.verse: And when he entered Jerusalem, the whole city was in turmoil, asking, “Who is this?”

11.verse: And the crowds said, “This is the prophet, Jesus from Nazareth of Galilee.”

12.verse: And Jesus entered the temple and drove out all who were selling and buying in the temple, and he overturned the tables of the moneychangers and the chairs of those who were selling doves.

13.verse: And he said to them, “It stands written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you are making it a den of thieves.”

14.verse: Then the blind and the lame came to him in the temple and he healed them.

15.verse: But when the ruling priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children who were crying out in the temple, “Hosanna to the Son of David!” they were indignant,

16.verse: and they said to him, “Do you hear what they are saying?” “Yes,” replied Jesus, “but have you never read, ‘Out of the mouth of infants and nursing babies you have brought forth praise’?”

17.verse: And leaving them, he went out of the city to Bethany and spent the night there.

18.verse: In the morning, as he was returning to the city, he became hungry.

19.verse: And seeing a fig tree by the road, he went over to it and found nothing on it except leaves only. And he said to it, “May no fruit ever come from you for all time!” And at once the fig tree withered away.

20.verse: When the disciples saw this, they were astonished and said, “How did the fig tree wither away so quickly?”

21.verse: And Jesus answered them, “I tell you the truth, if you have faith and do not doubt, not only will you do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, ‘Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,’ it will happen.

22.verse: And whatever you ask in prayer, if you believe, you will receive.”

23.verse: And when he had entered the temple, the ruling priests and the elders of the people approached him while he was teaching and said, “By what authority are you doing these things, and who gave you this authority?”

24.verse: Jesus answered them, saying, “I also will ask you one question, and if you give me an answer, then I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

25.verse: The baptism of John, where did it come from? From heaven or from man?” They reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say to us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

26.verse: But if we say, ‘From man,’ we are afraid of the crowd, for they hold that John was a prophet.”

27.verse: So they answered Jesus, saying, “We do not know.” And he said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.

28.verse: “What do you think? A man had two sons, and he went to the first and said, ‘Son, go and work today in the vineyard.’

29.verse: And he answered, saying, ‘I will not,’ but later he changed his mind and went.

30.verse: Then the man went to the second son and said the same thing. And he answered, saying, ‘I will, sir,’ but he did not go.

31.verse: Which of the two did the will of his father?” They said, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “I tell you the truth, tax collectors and prostitutes will enter the kingdom of God before you!

32.verse: For John came to show you the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him; but tax collectors and prostitutes did believe. And even when you saw it, you did not change your minds afterward and believe him.

33.verse: “Listen to another parable: There was a landowner who planted a vineyard. He put a fence around it, dug a winepress in it, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to tenants and went away on a journey.

34.verse: When the harvest time drew near, he sent his servants to the tenants to collect his share of the crop.

35.verse: But the tenants seized his servants; one they severely beat, another they killed, and still another they stoned.

36.verse: Then he sent other servants, more than the first time, and they did the same to them.

37.verse: Finally he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

38.verse: But when the tenants saw the son, they said to one another, ‘This is the heir; come on, let us kill him and take his inheritance.’

39.verse: So they seized him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

40.verse: Now when the owner of the vineyard returns, what will he do to those tenants?”

41.verse: They said to him, “He will bring those wretches to a wretched end and lease the vineyard to other tenants who will give him his share at their harvest.”

42.verse: Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures: ‘A stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone; this was the Lord’s doing, and it is amazing in our eyes’?

43.verse: Therefore I tell you that the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.”

44.verse: and the one who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces; and upon whomever it falls, it will crush him

45.verse: When the ruling priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they perceived that he was speaking about them.

46.verse: And although they wanted to arrest him, they were afraid of the crowds because they held him to be a prophet.

1.verse: Once again Jesus spoke to them in parables, saying:

2.verse: “The kingdom of heaven is like a king who prepared a wedding feast for his son

3.verse: and sent his servants to call those who had been invited to the feast; but they would not come.

4.verse: Then he sent other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who have been invited, “See, I have prepared my banquet, my oxen and fattened calves have been slaughtered, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding feast.”’

5.verse: But they paid no attention and went on their way, one to his farm, another to his business,

6.verse: while the rest seized his servants, treated them shamefully, and killed them.

7.verse: The king was furious! He sent his troops and destroyed those murderers and burned their city to the ground.

8.verse: Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding feast is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.

9.verse: Go therefore to the busy intersections and invite everyone you can find to the wedding feast.’

10.verse: So those servants went out into the streets and gathered everyone they could find, rogues as well as honorable men; and the wedding hall was packed with guests.

11.verse: But when the king came in to see the guests, he noticed a man there who was not wearing a wedding garment.

12.verse: And he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without a wedding garment?’ And the man was speechless.

13.verse: Then the king said to his assistants, ‘Bind him foot and hand and throw him out into outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’

14.verse: For many are called, but few are chosen.”

15.verse: Then the Pharisees went out and plotted how they could trap him in what he said.

16.verse: And they sent their disciples to him along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that you are true and teach the way of God in truth, and show deference to no one, for you are not swayed by appearances.

17.verse: So tell us, what do you think? Is it proper to pay a tax to Caesar or not?”

18.verse: But Jesus, perceiving their evil intent, said, “Why are you testing me, you hypocrites?

19.verse: Show me the coin used for the tax.” So they brought him a denarius.

20.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Whose image is this, and whose inscription?”

21.verse: They answered him, “Caesar’s.” Then he said to them, “Render therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”

22.verse: When they heard this they were astonished, so they left him and went away.

23.verse: On that day the Sadducees who say there is no resurrection came to him and posed a question.

24.verse: They said, “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies having no children, his brother must marry his widow and raise up children for his brother.’

25.verse: Now there were seven brothers among us; the first one married and died, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother.

26.verse: So also the second and the third, and so on to the seventh.

27.verse: Finally, the woman died as well.

28.verse: Therefore in the resurrection, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had married her.”

29.verse: Jesus answered them, saying, “You are mistaken, because you know neither the Scriptures nor the power of God.

30.verse: For in the resurrection they will neither marry nor be given in marriage, but will be like the angels in heaven.

31.verse: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God:

32.verse: ‘I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead but of the living.”

33.verse: And when the crowd heard this, they were astounded at his teaching.

34.verse: Now when the Pharisees heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, they met together

35.verse: and one of them, an expert in the law, wanted to test him, and asked,

36.verse: “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?”

37.verse: And he said to him, “‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your mind.’

38.verse: This is the greatest and first commandment.

39.verse: And a second is like it, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’

40.verse: On these two commandments depends the whole Law and the Prophets.”

41.verse: Now while the Pharisees were assembled, Jesus put this question to them:

42.verse: “What do you think about the Messiah? Whose son is he?” They said to him, “David’s.”

43.verse: He said to them, “How then does David in the Spirit call him ‘Lord,’ saying,

44.verse: ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet”’?

45.verse: If therefore David calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?”

46.verse: And no one was able to answer him a word, nor did anyone dare to question him any more from that day on.

1.verse: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to his disciples,

2.verse: saying, “The scribes and the Pharisees now sit on the chair of Moses.

3.verse: Therefore put into practice and continue to do whatever they tell you; but do not imitate what they do, for they teach but do not practice.

4.verse: For they tie up heavy burdens, hard to bear, and lay them on people’s shoulders, but they themselves are not willing to move them with their finger.

5.verse: They do all their deeds to be seen by others: they make their phylacteries broad and their tassels long,

6.verse: they love the place of honor at banquets and the most important seats in the synagogues,

7.verse: and greetings in the marketplaces, and to be called ‘Rabbi’ by others.

8.verse: But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have but one teacher, and you are all brothers.

9.verse: And do not call anyone on earth your ‘father,’ for you have but one Father, and he is in heaven.

10.verse: Nor should you be called ‘instructors,’ because Christ is your only instructor.

11.verse: The greatest among you will be your servant.

12.verse: And whoever will exalt himself will be humbled, and whoever will humble himself will be exalted.

13.verse: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you shut the kingdom of heaven in men’s faces. For you neither enter yourselves nor allow those who would enter to go in.

14.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

15.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you travel over sea and land to gain a single convert; and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of hell as yourselves.

16.verse: “Woe to you, blind guides who say, ‘If someone swears by the temple it means nothing; but if someone swears by the gold of the temple, he is bound by his oath.’

17.verse: You fools and blind men! For which is greater, the gold or the temple that makes the gold sacred?

18.verse: And you say, ‘If someone swears by the altar it means nothing; but if someone swears by the gift that is on it, he is bound by his oath.’

19.verse: How blind you are! For which is greater, the gift or the altar that makes the gift sacred?

20.verse: So the one who swears by the altar, swears not only by it but by everything on it.

21.verse: And the one who swears by the temple, swears not only by it but by the one who dwells there.

22.verse: And the one who swears by heaven, swears not only by the throne of God but by the one who sits on it.

23.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you tithe mint and dill and cumin, and have neglected the weightier matters of the law: justice and mercy and faithfulness. These you ought to have done without neglecting the former.

24.verse: You blind guides! You strain out the gnat but gulp down the camel!

25.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you clean off the outside of the cup and the plate while inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.

26.verse: You blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup, so that its outside may become clean too.

27.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you are like whitewashed tombs that look beautiful on the outside but on the inside are full of dead men’s bones and all kinds of filth.

28.verse: So you also outwardly appear to others as righteous but within you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.

29.verse: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you build the tombs of the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous,

30.verse: and you say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we would not have taken part with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’

31.verse: By saying this you testify against yourselves that you are descendants of those who murdered the prophets.

32.verse: Fill up then the measure of your fathers’ guilt.

33.verse: You snakes! You brood of vipers! How will you escape from being condemned to hell?

34.verse: Therefore I am sending you prophets and wise men and scribes, some of whom you will kill and crucify, and some of whom you will flog in your synagogues and pursue from town to town,

35.verse: so that upon you will come all the righteous blood shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Barachiah, whom you murdered between the sanctuary and the altar.

36.verse: I tell you the truth, all these things will come upon this generation.

37.verse: “Jerusalem, O Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those who are sent to you! How often have I wanted to gather your children together as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing!

38.verse: Look, your house is left to you desolate!

39.verse: For I say to you, you will not see me from now until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.’”

1.verse: When Jesus had left the temple and was walking away, his disciples came up to call his attention to the buildings of the temple.

2.verse: And he responded to them, saying, “You see all these things, do you not? I tell you the truth, not even one stone will be left here upon another that will not be thrown down.”

3.verse: And when he was seated on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately, saying, “Tell us, when are these things to take place, and what will be the sign of your coming and the consummation of the age?”

4.verse: And Jesus answered them, saying, “Take care that no one leads you astray.

5.verse: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and they will lead many astray.

6.verse: And you will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not alarmed, for this must take place but the end is not yet.

7.verse: For nation will rise up against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and there will be famines and earthquakes in various places.

8.verse: But all these things are only the beginning of birth pangs.

9.verse: Then they will hand you over to be persecuted and will kill you, and you will be hated by all nations because of my name.

10.verse: At that time many will fall away and will betray one another and hate one another.

11.verse: And many false prophets will arise and lead many astray;

12.verse: and because lawlessness will be increased, the love of many will grow cold.

13.verse: But the one who endures to the end will be saved.

14.verse: And this gospel of the kingdom will be proclaimed in all the world as a testimony to every nation, and then the end will come.

15.verse: “Therefore when you see the ‘abomination of desolation’ spoken of by the prophet Daniel, standing in the holy place (let the reader understand),

16.verse: then those who are in Judea must flee to the mountains,

17.verse: the one on the housetop must not go down to gather up what is in his house,

18.verse: and the one in the field must not go back to pick up his coat.

19.verse: But woe to women who are pregnant and to mothers who are nursing babies in those days!

20.verse: And pray that your flight will not be in winter or on a Sabbath.

21.verse: For then there will be great suffering, such as has not been from the beginning of the world until now, and will never be again.

22.verse: And unless those days were shortened, no human being would survive. But for the sake of the elect those days will be shortened.

23.verse: Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘There he is!’ Do not believe him.

24.verse: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear, and they will perform great signs and wonders so as to lead astray, if that were possible, even the elect.

25.verse: Mark well, I have warned you in advance.

26.verse: So, if they say to you, ‘There he is, out in the wilderness!’ do not go out; or, ‘Here he is, in the inner rooms!’ do not believe it.

27.verse: For as the lightning comes from the east and flashes to the west, so will the coming of the Son of Man be.

28.verse: Wherever the corpse is, there the vultures will gather.

29.verse: “Immediately after the suffering of those days, the sun will be darkened and the moon will not give its light, and the stars will fall from the sky and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

30.verse: And then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky with power and great glory.

31.verse: And he will send his angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.

32.verse: “Learn this parable from the fig tree: as soon as its branch becomes tender and puts out its leaves, you know that summer is near.

33.verse: So also, when you see all these things, you know that it is near, at the very door.

34.verse: I tell you the truth, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.

35.verse: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

36.verse: “But concerning that day and hour, no one knows, neither the angels of heaven nor the Son, but the Father only.

37.verse: For as were the days of Noah, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

38.verse: For as in the days before the flood people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day Noah entered the ark,

39.verse: and they knew nothing until the flood came and took them all away, so will the coming of the Son of Man be.

40.verse: At that time two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left.

41.verse: Two women will be grinding at the mill; one will be taken and the other left.

42.verse: Therefore be alert, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.

43.verse: But understand this: if the owner of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have been on the alert and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.

44.verse: For this reason you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour you do not expect.

45.verse: “Who then is the faithful and wise servant whom his master has put in charge of his household to give other servants their food at the proper time?

46.verse: Blessed is that servant whom his master will find so doing when he returns.

47.verse: I tell you the truth, he will put that servant in charge of all his possessions.

48.verse: But suppose that servant is wicked and says in his heart, ‘My master is slow to return,’

49.verse: and begins to beat his fellow servants, and eats and drinks with drunkards;

50.verse: the master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect and at an hour that he does not know,

51.verse: and will cut him in pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

1.verse: “At that time the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their torches and went out to meet the bridegroom.

2.verse: Now five of them were foolish and five were wise.

3.verse: For when the foolish took their torches, they did not take oil with them.

4.verse: But the wise took oil in containers along with their torches.

5.verse: Now since the bridegroom was slow in coming, they all became drowsy and fell asleep.

6.verse: But at midnight there was a shout, ‘Look, the bridegroom! Come out to meet him.’

7.verse: Then all those virgins woke up and prepared their torches.

8.verse: The foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, because our torches are going out.’

9.verse: But the wise answered, saying, ‘Perhaps there will not be enough for both us and you, so go rather to the dealers and buy some for yourselves.’

10.verse: And while they were away buying it, the bridegroom came and the virgins who were ready went in with him to the wedding feast, and the door was shut.

11.verse: Later the other virgins came, saying, ‘Sir! Sir! Open the door for us.’

12.verse: But he replied, saying, ‘I tell you the truth, I do not know you!’

13.verse: Therefore stay alert, because you know neither the day nor the hour.

14.verse: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a man about to leave on a long trip, who called in his servants and entrusted his money to them.

15.verse: To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one—to each according to his ability. Then he went on his journey.

16.verse: The one who had received five talents went immediately and put his money to work and gained another five.

17.verse: Likewise the one who had the two gained another two.

18.verse: But the servant who had received the one talent went out and dug a hole in the ground and hid his master’s money.

19.verse: Now after a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.

20.verse: The one who had received the five talents came and brought another five, saying, ‘Master, you entrusted five talents to me; look, I have gained five more.’

21.verse: His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been trustworthy in a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master.’

22.verse: The one who had received the two talents also came, saying, “Master, you entrusted two talents to me. Look, I have gained two more.’

23.verse: His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been trustworthy in a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Enter into the joy of your master.’

24.verse: Then the one who had received the one talent also came, saying, ‘Master, I knew that you were an unscrupulous man, reaping where you have not sown and gathering where you scattered no seed;

25.verse: and being afraid, I went off and hid your talent in the ground. Look, you have what is yours.’

26.verse: But his master answered him, saying, ‘You wicked and lazy servant! You knew that I reap where I have not sown and gather where I scattered no seed?

27.verse: Then you ought to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my return I would have recovered what was mine plus interest!

28.verse: So take the talent away from him, and give it to the one who has the ten talents.

29.verse: For to everyone who has will more be given, and he will have an abundance; but from him who has not, even what he has will be taken from him.

30.verse: And throw the worthless servant into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’

31.verse: “When the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, then he will sit on his glorious throne.

32.verse: All the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate the people one from another as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats;

33.verse: and he will place the sheep on his right, and the goats on the left.

34.verse: Then the King will say to those on his right, ‘Come, you who are blessed by my Father; inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

35.verse: For I was hungry and you gave me food, I was thirsty and you gave me drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in,

36.verse: I was naked and you clothed me, I was sick and you took care of me, I was in prison and you visited me.’

37.verse: Then the righteous will answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you drink?

38.verse: And when did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or naked and clothe you?

39.verse: And when did we see you sick or in prison and visit you?’

40.verse: And the King will answer them, saying, ‘I tell you the truth, insofar as you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’

41.verse: “Then he will say to those on his left, ‘Depart from me, you cursed ones, to the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.

42.verse: For I was hungry and you gave me no food, I was thirsty and you gave me no drink,

43.verse: I was a stranger and you did not invite me in, naked and you did not clothe me, sick and in prison and you did not visit me.’

44.verse: Then they also will answer, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison and did not help you?’

45.verse: Then he will answer them, saying, ‘I tell you the truth, insofar as you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to me.’

46.verse: And these will depart to eternal punishment, but the righteous to eternal life.”

1.verse: When Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said to his disciples,

2.verse: “You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified.”

3.verse: Then the ruling priests and the elders of the people gathered in the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,

4.verse: and they plotted together to seize Jesus by stealth and kill him.

5.verse: But they said, “Not during the feast, lest there be a riot among the people.”

6.verse: Now while Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

7.verse: a woman came to him with an alabaster flask of very expensive perfume that she poured over his head as he reclined at table.

8.verse: And when the disciples saw it, they were indignant and said, “Why this waste?

9.verse: For this could have been sold for a high price and the money given to the poor.”

10.verse: But aware of this, Jesus said to them, “Why are you causing trouble for the woman? For she has done a kind thing to me.

11.verse: You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.

12.verse: For by pouring this perfume on my body, she has prepared me for burial.

13.verse: I tell you the truth, wherever this gospel is proclaimed throughout the world, what she has done will also be recounted as her memorial to me.”

14.verse: Then one of the twelve, the one named Judas Iscariot, went to the ruling priests

15.verse: and asked, “What are you willing to give me if I betray him to you?” And they agreed to pay him thirty silver coins.

16.verse: So from then on he watched for an opportunity to betray Jesus.

17.verse: Now on the first day of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Where do you want us to make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”

18.verse: He said, “Go into the city to a certain man and say to him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is at hand. I will be keeping the Passover at your house with my disciples.”’”

19.verse: So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them and made preparations for the Passover.

20.verse: Now when evening came, Jesus was reclining at table with the twelve.

21.verse: And as they were eating he said, “I tell you the truth, one of you will betray me.”

22.verse: And they were greatly distressed and began to say to him one after another, “Surely not I, Lord?”

23.verse: Jesus answered, saying, “The one who has dipped his hand into the bowl with me will betray me.

24.verse: The Son of Man will depart as it is written of him, but woe to that one by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been better for that man had he not been born.”

25.verse: Then Judas, who would betray him, said, “Surely not I, Rabbi?” Jesus answered him, “It is as you have said.”

26.verse: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread; and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to his disciples, saying, “Take, eat; this is my body.”

27.verse: And he took a cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you,

28.verse: for this is my blood of the covenant that is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.

29.verse: But I say to you, I will never drink again of this fruit of the vine until that day when I drink the new wine with you in the kingdom of my Father.”

30.verse: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

31.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away because of me this very night. For it stands written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’

32.verse: But after I have been raised, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”

33.verse: Peter answered, saying to him, “Though they all fall away because of you, I will never fall away.”

34.verse: Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, this very night, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”

35.verse: Peter said to him, “Even though I must die with you, I will never deny you!” And all the disciples said the same.

36.verse: Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane and he said to his disciples, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”

37.verse: And taking with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, he began to be sorrowful and troubled.

38.verse: Then he said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, to the point of death; remain here and keep watch with me.”

39.verse: And going a short distance beyond them, he fell on his face, praying, “My Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from me! Yet not as I will but as you will.”

40.verse: Then he went to the disciples and found them sleeping. He said to Peter, “So, could you men not keep watch with me for a single hour?

41.verse: Stay alert and pray lest you enter a time of trial. The spirit indeed is willing but the flesh is weak.”

42.verse: Once again he went away and prayed, saying, “My Father, if this cannot pass unless I drink it, may your will be done.”

43.verse: Then he returned and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.

44.verse: So he left them again and went away, and for the third time prayed again using the same words.

45.verse: Then he returned to his disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and taking your rest? Look, the hour has come, and the Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of sinners.

46.verse: Get up, let us be going. Look, here comes my betrayer.”

47.verse: While he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, arrived accompanied by a large crowd from the ruling priests and the elders of the people, armed with swords and clubs.

48.verse: The betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “The one I will kiss, he is the one; seize him.”

49.verse: Without hesitation Judas went up to Jesus and said, “Greetings, Rabbi!” and kissed him.

50.verse: Jesus said to him, “Comrade, do what you came to do.” Then they came forward, laid hands on Jesus and took him into custody.

51.verse: But one of those with Jesus stretched out his hand, drew his sword, and struck the slave of the high priest, cutting off his ear.

52.verse: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back into its place! For all who draw the sword will die by the sword.

53.verse: Or do you think that I cannot ask of my Father, and he will immediately place at my disposal more than twelve legions of angels?

54.verse: But how then would the scriptures be fulfilled that say it must happen in this way?”

55.verse: At that time Jesus said to the crowds, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to capture me as though I were a robber? Every day I sat in the temple teaching, and you did not arrest me.

56.verse: But all this has happened that the writings of the prophets might be fulfilled.” Then the disciples all deserted him and ran away.

57.verse: Then the men who had laid hold of Jesus took him to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered.

58.verse: And Peter followed him at a distance, up to the courtyard of the high priest; then going inside he sat down with the guards to see the end.

59.verse: Now the ruling priests and the entire Sanhedrin were looking for false testimony against Jesus so they could put him to death,

60.verse: but they found none, even though many false witnesses came forward. Finally two came forward

61.verse: and declared, “This man said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.’”

62.verse: And the high priest stood up and said to him, “Have you no answer to the charge these men are bringing against you?”

63.verse: But Jesus remained silent. Then the high priest said to him, “I put you under oath by the living God, tell us if you are the Messiah, the Son of God.”

64.verse: Jesus said to him, “It is as you have said. Yet I tell you, from now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of The Power and coming on the clouds of heaven.”

65.verse: Then the high priest tore his robes and said, “He has blasphemed! What further need do we have of witnesses? You have now heard his blasphemy.

66.verse: What is your verdict?” They answered, saying, “He is deserving of death!”

67.verse: Then they spat in his face and struck him; and some slapped him,

68.verse: saying, “Prophesy to us, you messiah! Who is it that struck you?”

69.verse: Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard; and a servant girl came up to him and said, “You too were with Jesus of Galilee.”

70.verse: But he denied it before them all, saying, “I do not know what you are talking about.”

71.verse: Then he went out into the gateway, where another servant girl saw him and said to those who were there, “This man was with Jesus the Nazarene.”

72.verse: But again he denied it with an oath, “I do not know the man!”

73.verse: And after a little while those standing around came up to Peter and said, “Surely you too are one of them, for the way you talk makes it clear.”

74.verse: Then he began to invoke curses on himself and swear to them, “I do not know that man!” And immediately the rooster crowed.

75.verse: Then Peter remembered what Jesus had said, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.” And he went outside and wept bitterly.

1.verse: Early in the morning, all the ruling priests and the elders of the people laid plans against Jesus, how they might put him to death.

2.verse: And when they had bound him, they led him away and turned him over to Pilate the governor.

3.verse: Then when Judas, his betrayer, saw that Jesus was condemned, he was filled with remorse and brought the thirty silver coins back to the ruling priests and elders,

4.verse: saying, “I have sinned; I betrayed innocent blood.” But they said, “What is that to us? It is your responsibility!”

5.verse: Then he threw the silver coins into the temple and left; and going away, he hanged himself.

6.verse: But the ruling priests, picking up the coins, said, “It is not lawful to put these into the treasury, since it is blood money.”

7.verse: So they consulted with one another and with the money bought the potter’s field as a place to bury foreigners.

8.verse: Therefore that field has been called the “Field of Blood” to this very day.

9.verse: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by the prophet Jeremiah, saying, “They took the thirty silver coins, the price of him on whom a price had been set by some of the sons of Israel,

10.verse: and they gave them for the potter’s field as the Lord directed me.”

11.verse: Then Jesus stood before the governor; and the governor questioned him, saying, “Are you the king of the Jews?” Jesus said, “You say so.”

12.verse: But when he was accused by the ruling priests and elders, he gave no answer.

13.verse: Then Pilate said to him, “Do you not hear how many accusations they are bringing against you?”

14.verse: But Jesus refused to answer even a single charge, so that the governor was greatly astonished.

15.verse: Now at festival time the governor was accustomed to release one prisoner for the crowd, whomever they wanted.

16.verse: At that time they were holding in custody a notorious prisoner named Jesus Barabbas.

17.verse: So when the crowd had gathered, Pilate said to them, “Which one do you want me to release for you: Jesus Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Messiah?”

18.verse: For he knew that it was out of envy that they had handed him over.

19.verse: But while Pilate was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent him a message, saying, “Have nothing to do with that innocent man; for I have suffered many things in a dream today on account of him.”

20.verse: But the ruling priests and the elders persuaded the crowds to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus executed.

21.verse: Once again the governor asked them, “Which of the two do you want me to release for you?” And they said, “Barabbas.”

22.verse: Pilate said to them, “Then what shall I do with Jesus who is called Messiah?” With one voice they shouted, “Let him be crucified!”

23.verse: Pilate asked, “But what crime has he committed?” But they shouted all the louder, “Crucify him!”

24.verse: So when Pilate saw that he was getting nowhere but rather that a riot was starting, he took water and washed his hands before the crowd, saying, “I am innocent of this man’s blood; it is your responsibility.”

25.verse: And all the people answered, saying, “Let his blood be on us and on our children!”

26.verse: Then he released Barabbas for them, but he scourged Jesus and handed him over to be crucified.

27.verse: Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the praetorium and gathered the entire garrison around him.

28.verse: They stripped him and put a scarlet cloak on him;

29.verse: and twisting together a crown of thorns, they placed it on his head. They put a staff in his right hand, and kneeling before him they mocked him, saying, “Hail, king of the Jews!”

30.verse: And they spat on him, and took the staff and kept beating him over the head.

31.verse: And when they finished mocking him, they stripped him of the cloak and put his own clothes back on and led him away to crucify him.

32.verse: As they were going out, they came across a man named Simon, from Cyrene. This man they conscripted to carry his cross.

33.verse: And when they came to a place called Golgotha, which means “Place of a Skull,”

34.verse: they gave him wine mixed with gall to drink; but after tasting it, he refused to drink it.

35.verse: And when they had crucified him, they divided his clothes among them by casting lots.

36.verse: Then they sat down and kept watch over him there.

37.verse: And above his head they put the charge against him, which read, “This is Jesus, the king of the Jews.”

38.verse: Then two robbers were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.

39.verse: And those who passed by derided him, wagging their heads

40.verse: and saying, “You who would destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!”

41.verse: The ruling priests along with the scribes and the elders were also mocking him in the same way, saying,

42.verse: “He saved others, but he is not able to save himself! He is the king of Israel! Let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe in him!

43.verse: He has put his trust in God; let God rescue him now if he wants him; for he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”

44.verse: And the robbers who were crucified with him were taunting him in the same way.

45.verse: And from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.

46.verse: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out in a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?”—which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”

47.verse: But when some of those standing there heard it, they said, “This man is calling for Elijah.”

48.verse: And one of them at once ran and got a sponge, filled it with sour wine, put it on a staff, and gave it to him to drink.

49.verse: But the others said, “Wait, let us see whether Elijah will come to save him.”

50.verse: And Jesus cried out again in a loud voice and gave up his spirit.

51.verse: Just then the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom; and the earth shook, and the rocks were split;

52.verse: the tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised.

53.verse: After his resurrection they came out of the tombs and entered the holy city and appeared to many.

54.verse: When the centurion and those with him, who were keeping watch over Jesus, saw the earthquake and what was happening, they were terrified, and said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!”

55.verse: And looking on from a distance were many women who had followed Jesus from Galilee to care for his needs.

56.verse: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.

57.verse: Toward sunset, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who himself was also a disciple of Jesus.

58.verse: This man approached Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered that it be given to him.

59.verse: And Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen shroud,

60.verse: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had cut in the rock. Then he rolled a large stone against the door of the tomb and went away.

61.verse: Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were there, sitting across from the tomb.

62.verse: On the following day, that is, after the day of Preparation, the ruling priests and the Pharisees went as a group to Pilate.

63.verse: They said, “Sir, we remember that while he was still alive that impostor said, ‘After three days I will be raised.’

64.verse: Therefore order the tomb to be made secure until the third day, lest his disciples come and steal him and say to the people, ‘He has been raised from the dead,’ and the last deceit will be greater than the first.”

65.verse: Pilate said to them, “Take a guard of soldiers; go and make it as secure as you know how.”

66.verse: So they went and made the tomb secure by sealing the stone and setting the guard

1.verse: Now after the Sabbath, toward daybreak of the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to see the tomb.

2.verse: And behold, there was a great earthquake; for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven and, going to the tomb, rolled away the stone and sat on it.

3.verse: His appearance was like lightning and his clothing white as snow.

4.verse: And for fear of him the guards trembled and became like dead men.

5.verse: But the angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified.

6.verse: He is not here, for he has been raised, just as he said. Come, see the place where he was lying.

7.verse: Go quickly and tell his disciples that he has been raised from the dead and is going ahead of you to Galilee. You will see him there. Remember, I have told you.”

8.verse: So they left the tomb at once, with fear and great joy, and ran to break the news to his disciples.

9.verse: Suddenly Jesus met them and said, “Good morning!” And they came to him, took hold of his feet, and worshipped him.

10.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go, tell my brothers to depart for Galilee, and they will see me there.”

11.verse: While they were on their way, some of the guard went into the city and reported to the ruling priests everything that had taken place.

12.verse: And when the priests had met with the elders and worked out a plan, they gave a considerable sum of money to the soldiers

13.verse: and told them, “You are to say, ‘His disciples came by night and stole his body while we were sleeping.’

14.verse: And if this should come to the governor’s ears, we will bribe him and keep you out of trouble.”

15.verse: So they took the money and did as they were directed. And this story has been circulated among Jews to this very day.

16.verse: So the eleven disciples went to Galilee to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.

17.verse: And when they saw him, they worshiped him, but some hesitated.

18.verse: And Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.

19.verse: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

20.verse: teaching them to observe everything that I have commanded you. And remember, I am with you all the days, to the end of the age.”
